Biography Keke Chen received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Georgia Tech in 2006. Before joining UMBC, he was a Northwestern Mutual associate professor of Computer Science at Marquette University. Before Marquette, he was an associate professor at Wright State University and a senior research scientist at Yahoo! Labs. His research interests include security and privacy issues in AI, data mining and machine learning algorithms, and distributed systems. NSF, NIH, Air Force Research Lab, DoD/AFOSR, Northwestern Mutual Data Science Institute, and Amazon have supported his research projects. He is also an associate editor for ACM Trans. on Internet Technology, Frontiers in Big Data, and the Data Journal.
